citeinfo.title: Evapotranspiration in the Upper Klamath Basin for October 2013

descript.abstract: The evapotranspiration (ET) datasets were created under contract for this study by the University of Idaho. A high-resolution remote sensing technique known as Mapping Evapotranspiration at High Resolution and Internalized Calibration (METRIC) was used to create estimates of the spatial distribution of ET. The METRIC technique uses thermal infrared Landsat imagery to quantify actual evapotranspiration at a 30-meter resolution that can be related to individual irrigated fields. Because evaporation uses heat energy, ground surfaces with large ET rates are left cooler as a result of ET than ground surfaces that have less ET. As a consequence, irrigated fields appear in the Landsat images as cooler than nonirrigated fields. Products produced from this study include total seasonal and total monthly (April-October) actual evapotranspiration maps for 2013.
descript.purpose: This dataset adds to the collection of METRIC-derived evapotranspiration products in the Klamath Basin.
descript.supplinf: See the University of Idaho report, titled: Production of Satellite-based Maps of Evapotranspiration using the METRICtm Model for Year 2013 in the Klamath River Basin of Oregon-- Landsat Path 45 Rows 30 and 31

browse.browsed: Thumbnail image of 30-meter ERDAS IMAGINE raster showing monthly evapotranspiration for October, 2013 in Landsat Path 45, Rows 30 and 31

idinfo.native: Environment as of Metadata Creation: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1 (Build 4959) Service Pack N/A (Build N/A)

attracc.attraccr: See the University of Idaho report, titled: Production of Satellite-based Maps of Evapotranspiration using the METRICtm Model for Year 2013 in the Klamath River Basin of Oregon-- Landsat Path 45 Rows 30 and 31. See section 2 for details on how Landsat images were selected and pre-processed. See sections 3 and 5 for METRIC model calibration. See section 4 for weather data quality assessment and quality control. See section 6 for image sharpening, Landsat 7 gapfilling, cloud cover management, open-water ET, and comparing ET with precipitation.

dataqual.logic: See the University of Idaho report, titled: Production of Satellite-based Maps of Evapotranspiration using the METRICtm Model for Year 2013 in the Klamath River Basin of Oregon-- Landsat Path 45 Rows 30 and 31. See sections 3-5 for discussions on calibration of the METRIC model.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details and the accompanying University of Idaho report, titled: Production of Satellite-based Maps of Evapotranspiration using the METRICtm Model for Year 2013 in the Klamath River Basin of Oregon-- Landsat Path 45 Rows 30 and 31.

horizpa.horizpar: No formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has been conducted. The horizontal accuracy is limited to METRIC input datasets described in the metadata source input section.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set is not applicable.

citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey Center for Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS)
citeinfo.title: Landsat Thematic Mapper (TM)

srcinfo.srccontr: The METRIC procedure used to generate this dataset utilizes the visible, near-infrared and thermal infrared energy spectrum bands from Landsat satellite images and weather data to calculate ET on a pixel by pixel basis.
A land use map was used to support the estimation of aerodynamic roughness and soil heat flux during METRIC processing.

A digital elevation map (DEM) is used during METRIC processing to adjust surface temperatures for lapse effects caused by elevation variation. Maps of slope and aspect (aspect is the cardinal direction of an inclined surface) are also derived from the DEM at 30 m resolution and are used in estimating solar radiation on slopes. These images were created using the tools of the ERDAS Imagine processing system based on the DEM.
AgriMet weather station data were used to calculate reference evapotranspiration for use in the METRIC model.
RAWS data were used to calculate reference evapotranspiration for use in the METRIC model.
CIMIS weather station data were used to calculate reference evapotranspiration for use in the METRIC model.

procstep.procdesc: See the University of Idaho report, titled: Production of Satellite-based Maps of Evapotranspiration using the METRICtm Model for Year 2013 in the Klamath River Basin of Oregon-- Landsat Path 45 Rows 30 and 31

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

attr.attrdef: Evapotranspiration, in mm, for the month of October, 2013. ET values less than zero should be considered equal to zero. Values of 200 and -200 outside of image boundaries should be considered no data.

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Review the rest of the metadata record for additional details and information.
